actions.text: Reported to House from the Committee on the Budget, H. Rept. 95-1055.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in House.
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #300 (201-197).
Measure laid on table in House, S.Con.Res. 80 passed in lieu.

official_title: A resolution setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for the fiscal year 1979.

summary.text: (Measure passed House, amended, roll call #300 (201-197)) Sets forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 1979. States that the recommended level of Federal revenues is $443,023,235,000 and the amount by which the aggregate level of Federal revenues should be decreased $29,035,000,000. States that the appropriate level of total new budget authority is $564,508,158,000. Establishes the appropriate level of the public debt at $856,062,000,000. Sets forth the appropriate level of new budget authority and the estimated budget outlays for each major functional category.

titles.title: A resolution setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for the fiscal year 1979.
